intro: Calyptranthes rubella, commonly known as the red-leaf calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that turn a striking red or orange hue during the flowering season. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Calyptranthes rubella is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
